comment.text: The Vortex was high on our list of places to check out while in Atlanta, and I'm so happy we were able to make it! My boyfriend took down the single coronary bypass burger and was very full after, but really enjoyed it. The tots and fries were delish! I had the mini bbq pork sliders and loved that they were topped with mac. The side of mac was also so good! My boyfriend's mom loved the 50/50 chili too. It was such a cool vibe here and our waiter was super friendly, and he told my boyfriend he was impressed with him taking down the burger. I wish I could come here all the time!

I'm still new-ish to the Atlanta area. Vortex has been on my list for the past two years and I finally went for the first time this past summer. Vortex is a solid burger place for several reasons. 

Let's talk about their burgers - I can always tell a good burger place by the way they cook their burgers "well." That being said, I've gotten two well-done burgers and both were fully cooked through, soft, moist, and stayed together the entire time.  I've eaten at Vortex Midtown and Little Five Points and both get an A+ for burger consistency. 

Next, the variety of burgers they have. I like this restaurant for the sole reason they take all your favorite American foods, and toss them on a burger in the most special way. Their mixture of fresh and cooked ingredients topped with special sauces for each of their burgers make this place truly special. And hey, if you're not feeling beefy they also have chicken sandwiches, hot dogs, grilled cheese, chili, soup and salad (all pretty epic, especially their chili with that special cornbread). 

Finally, The Vortex is the type of place you take your friends from out of town for an experience they'll be sure to remember. If it's not the giant skull, tits, or quirky sayings that get their attention, the food will come out and they'll be sure to have a memorable experience. Hands down, 5 stars.
Even though they were busy, we got in less than the 45 minutes promised. Waiter attentive. Food was excellent. Great beer selection.

Finally got into the Vortex (five points location) to check out the hype! People the hype was a let down for me. Shrug! 

My burger which I ordered medium rare was cooked to a crunchy crisp and well dry.  The fries were nothing special to even whisper about.  What I did like was the MUTHACLUCKIN CHICKEN ROLLS! That was the BOMB! The combination of shredded chicken, cheese, onions and cilantro with the jalapeño ranch sauce is a must try!
Typical vortex. The vibe is always right. Never fails. Great burgers!!!  Always get a booth.

photos.caption: Texas something. With suppose to be crispy onion rings on Texas toast with fries

comment.text: Great atmosphere, love the music, , service was excellent, and the food was amazing.  My only complaints:  the onion rings but it's a preference on how I like them cooked.  They were still great.  Last complaint is that I'm leaving Georgia and I can't come back as soon as I would like!

Today is 4/15/23
Do not waste your time! The location on Peachtree is ten times better. My husband and I decided to try the Moreland location because it's closer to our home. 
First...We had to park down the street in a lot for $10.
Second... we paid for drinks and decided to wait on the balcony for our table which is extremely tight. An employee walked by and said "don't block the stairs". Very rude and uncalled for. My husband complained to management and we left. As we were leaving my husband told the hostess to cancel our table. She then started screaming "what did you say? I didn't hear you" like a maniac. The manager was nice and professional as well as a gentleman host at the front door.

Some of the employees had dirty hands and fingernails. The place smelled bad inside and out and just looked unsanitary. I've never had issues at the Peachtree location so don't waste your time.

That was one good burga'!

If you're a fan of blue cheese and mushrooms, the Blue Shroom Burger might be the best choice for you. 

I really enjoyed the atmosphere here, it's decorated well and the crowd is really friendly. We also had some fantastic service from Shelby, who shared recommendations that our table loved! Adding this spot to my must-do list in Atlanta.

I got the kawana and it was delicious. As was my bloody. But I really came to the ol yelpmachine to sing the praises of the staff. We were in on a Saturday afternoon with the rest of the tourists. Ie, people were being garbage. Everyone on staff was so patient and kind with these less-than-ideal humans, and they didn't deserve it. Rachel, our server, was a delight from start to finish. 
Great service, tasty food. Tip yer servers.

There was a wait but the food is great. Google the secret menu for more options when available. Staff is great and the vibes here are unique. We enjoyed ourselves. The drinks were awesome and food was superb.

photos.caption: Pickle Spear of Love  Muthacluckin' Chicken Rolls
Black & Blue burger with wing sauce, also can be referred to as the Big Blue Buffalo Burger from the secret menu.
Ultimate Patty Melt w/ fried zucchini

comment.text: I had the beyond blue cheese burger. It was so delicious. The fries were nice and hot. Reminded me of McDonald's fries and the drinks are super strong. Definitely will go again.

The entrance is dope AF! 

Customer service is out the window here with sarcasm in its place. Bring your sense of humor with you and join in on the fun. 

I got a "coronary bypass" & a"double coronary bypass". I still can't believe I ate that monstrous sandwich. Grilled cheese sandwich as the bun was delicious and nuts. So much bacon!! While eating the sandwich I could feel my arteries getting clogged and my heart beat slowing down. Lol. Such a good sandwich, definitely only eat in moderation. 

#ThisFeedsMySoul #ALilBitOfCyn

I used to be absolutely crazy about The Vortex! However, the prices have gone up, the food has gone down & the portions are NOT worth the price, at all. When you come here now, you're just paying for the name.

This place has a cool vibe. The food comes in big portions so if you're hungry definitely check this place out. The vortex doesn't sacrifice taste even though the portions are big. The Disco taters are supposed to be a take on the famous Canadian poutine. They were good but not quite poutine. They claim make the best burgers in ATL, they're good but not the best. I had the fat Elvis which peaked my interest, the combination of peanut butter and plantain works; but I believe they put a little too much peanut butter on the bun so if you get that ask for less peanut butter. The chopped cheese was very good and well cooked and prepared. The staff was down to earth and attentive. You will definitely leave this restaurant satisfied and full!

A great and fun place to visit in Atlanta! The food was delicious and came out hot. The burgers were cooked to perfection! Our waitress was awesome and made the experience even better! Our favorite part of the meal was the delicious fried pickles and jalapeño ranch sauce. Possibly the best fried pickles I've had! The only downside was parking. It was a challenge to find a spot for the restaurant. Overall, we would come back again the next time we visit Atlanta!

Decided to spend a Friday night here in 5 Points & visit some old favorites. Arrived at 10:30 ish & was advised by security to put our names on the waitlist. Instead we decided to walk around & check out the shops that were open. Well we should have put pur names on the list because the place was packed & poppin. After putting our names on the list & waiting about 30 mins or so, we were seated. Rachel, our wonderful server attended to us very well throughout the night even though we got there kind of late & they closed at 12a. I ordered the Southern Mess chicken sandwich topped w/ fried egg, bacon, & white gravy. Tater tots on the side. Excellent choice & great portion size for anyone. My friend ordered buffalo wings which, again were awesome! Spicy, but not too much & seasoned well. Highly recommend either of these. Next time, I will try one of their drinks from the bar.

I've been to the Vortex a few times and normally had good food and service. But on Friday, September 8th around 4:30pm, that changed. We were seated but never approached by service. So when my partner went to ask the host if there would be a server coming soon (after we watched another couple get seated and given water and silverware), he had a blank look on his face and said "I'm not sure." So we asked for a manager and the host said "Why because they'll need a reason." He finally goes to get the manager and her attitude and demeanor was horrible. Absolutely horrible and she told us he asked that in "case I'm in the back busy."  Ahd she told us "don't talk to him (the host) talk to me!" She was very very rude!! All we wanted was to eat a good burger and get treated like the paying customers we were. We didn't approach with an attitude or rudely.  But we were treated so rudely and disrespectfully by the host and the manager and it was extremely disappointing.

Food was awesome. That's the only thing ...  didn't really dig the snarky vibes in this place. Even the menu has snarky comments in it?? Didn't feel welcome in here at all. Server was weird energy as hell. Actually threw the silverware and napkins on the table as she walked past without saying a word or getting drinks in. When I ordered the salad I said surprise me with the dressing bc I didn't care. She rudely said "that doesn't help, we have a lot of dressings." Um ok... Service was slow af - waited FOREVER to get the check and then get it back. I could go on... Like I said, the food was very good, and the orders were correct. But there's a lot more to dining in somewhere besides the food itself. I couldn't fucking wait to get out of there. Would not be surprised at all if a manager leaves a snarky defensive comment to my review -- that would be very on brand.
Nothing much to report except get any burger. They're all good! Simple as that! Side note: sit out on the patio, well shaded and doesn't feel cramped in like inside the restaurant.
I absolutely love going here. The burgers are awesome, drinks are good . Great service

So the Vortez was new to me and I've always seen it but never went in. I went on a date, definitely a cute date idea if dinner dates are your thing. 

The inside is pretty cool to look at. There are many vintage posters and collectibles aligned the wall. It's pretty quiet in there so you can have a conversation if need be. The servers are nice as hell. The whole ambiance is a vibe.

The food is AMAZE-balls. This is a burger joint if you didn't know but those burgers are VERY unique and delicious! They have things like loaded fries and nachos too but the burger are all you need! The burgers are juicy and compliment the bread!

This is my favorite spot when I come to Atlanta. The best burgers in town with an awesome, extensive beer selection and great cocktails. 
My server today was Matthew and whatever his salary is he is underpaid. The guy introduced me to a great beer I never tried before and he was enthusiastic and knowledgeable. That dude is the best.
I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Black and Blue burger and Sloppy Joe sliders.

comment.text:
BEWARE- BEWARE- Today I met up with a friend for lunch at The Vortex L5P. The service was great, the food was perfect. The problem is later this afternoon I got a fraud alert from my bank. I have not used this card anywhere else except The Vortex. My card was attempted to be used online for a large purchase. I called The Vortex to let them know it's highly possible one of their employees is swiping card numbers from their customers. Manager really seemed uninterested and literally said, "I'll look into it but I don't know when it'll be". Didn't ask any questions as in, what was your servers name? What time were you here? What makes you think it was here? Nothing... 

I will return to the Vortex, but next time I'll be paying in cash. Just be aware. It could really happen anywhere but, I expected more concern from the manager about their employee.
Literally one of the best burgers ever.  Great service, bartender is super friendly and knows her stuff.   Quick to get food out and beer was nice and cold.  I would absolutely come back here.

Loved it! Got a table immediately, server was attentive, and vibe was fun. I got the swiss and mushroom sub beyond burger and it was fabulous. Lots of cool drink options that I will have to try next time. Fried pickle appetizer is a must!

Excellent burger place attached to a comedy club.  Trendy & a bit loud.  Decorations are relevant and dust-free!  Clean bathrooms.  Pictures on the walls might not be suitable for young children - this IS a bar.

The food is excellent!  I had Zombie & friend had Bleu Burger.  Both Perfectly cooked. Very well balanced.  The Zombie had heat, but not so much to detract from the flavor of the overall dish.  Generous portion of bleu cheese on the Bleu Burger.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
I will be returning.

If you have a large party, you may want to insist the wait person write your order down. We only had 2 people & 1 very minor item was missed.

Everytime I come this place does not disappoint! Food is amazing and unique the service and atmosphere are 5 I love bringing people who have never been here to here for brunch or dinner and they usually love it !
Yes the food was good my favorite was the egg rolls those things was so extra crispy with nice sauce yummy

The Vortex never disappoints if you're in the mood for burgers. I hadn't been in a long time so I forgot it was like a real bar and they check id upon entering. 

Service started out a little slow, but they got it together. I forgot what burger I had, but the beer and tater tots accompanied it well. 

My friend had the grilled cheese and tomato soup which she said was lackluster. 

There are a few more burgers I want to make sure I try so I'll be back for sure...and it won't take 3 years.

I ordered nachos with extra cheese and jalapeño ... they brought me this nachos with lettuce and sour cream and some salsa on the side ... supposedly I was supposed to list exactly what I wanted on the nachos... however I never mentioned lettuce... 


I love the vortex for its burgers  I've been coming since 2013. But somehow in 2021 this is allowed so I'm giving this experience a 3 maybe 2 because no for the music as well. ...

photos.caption: Lettuce nachos and gross Tap water

comment.text: What caught my attention was the entrance to this restaurant. Then I saw that they serve funnel cake as fries was the ultimate sign to walk my ass inside and eat. It was me, my boyfriend with my bother and sis in law. MAC 'N' CHEESY-CHANGA was so delicious! We all got 4 different burgers. Alllll 4 were amazing burgers!! I got the pickle rick burger of course but my boyfriends burger was the best. The SINGLE CORONARY BYPASS. Which is what they are known for. Amazing. Loved it!
The food was delicious. The music and atmosphere was fantastic. The drinks were yummy and plentiful. The service was top notch.

Food is 7/10. 
However the service from a waitress who was wearing walking boot was so BAD. She did her service basically without any smile, nice words. Cold face all the way and eventually threw the check on the table, grabbed the check from the table and turned around in half sec without any word. Yes, threw. So rude! 

But my husband was over nice and still gave her 20% tips. I would say 10% or none. We are supposed to pay the tips for excellent service, she doesn't deserve it at all!

My husband and I both felt very uncomfortable with her service because of the rudeness, but I heard she treated the white couple at the table right behind me very politely. 'Sure', 'Of course' sounds with smile. 

I don't want to label her as a racist even if I saw some customers mentioned 'racist' below, but definitely won't recommend this place to my brown and black friends.

To Manager/supervisor if you know who iam talking about, please let her know: If she doesn't like this job, please don't do it. If you don't like some customers, please let other serve. 

Ruined the food and mood completely.

I live a block away and have been going here for years. I would personally say they have one of the best staffs at any restaurant in Atlanta. They are always incredibly friendly and will take care of you every single time. Their burgers are consistently delicious and always cooked excellently. Try the Chicken Rolls as a appetizer they are in my opinion absolutely fantastic! I hope you enjoy if you do end up eating here!

Take out. Order at the bar.

Little Five points location

Veggue burger + fries. Got to friend's place, I got tater tots instead. Friend ordered a plain burger but it was mostly red in the middle.

Don't see the hype. My veggie burger was blackened too. Is the Midtown location any better? Maybe for the decor.

My friend went to Midtown location and liked though. Sonfar, just a-okay for me

106/2020

covid review:

indoor dining avail & seats at the bar.

amazing atmosphere - divey feel, but with elevated food and some craft beer. the staff is so much fun, i truly had some good laughs with the bar tender. i came one night at 845 and they werent taking any more people. so i drove my ass back at 6 the next night and grabbed a seat at the bar. is it worth it? hell yeah. the music is killer and the bar itself is fun.

Food:
mac n cheese was okay. i wasnt impressed at all. however, what the hell does a person who doesnt eat beef eat at the spot whos been named the best burger spot in town? im glad you asked. i got the impossible burger with the pickle rick toppings (minus the bacon). the flavors melted together perfectly. i would get this again, especially since the impossible burger had such a nice char on it. 

I hope when i come back, they will have a house made veggie burger!

photos.caption: Mac n cheese. Tastes like velveeta. I dont think they make it in house.
Impossible with pickle rick toppings. Amazing combo!

comment.text:
This place is quirky and the brashness of the house rules on the menu can be off putting but the food is good (as soon as I walked in about 2 self proclaimed regulars recommended the potato salad to me) and the bartenders were absolutely lovely. Service was quick which we appreciated. 

My burger (the one with pineapple) was perfection and  my Georgia peach mule was refreshing (brought my sister here and she was obsessed with this mule)...and they don't skimp on the alcohol. 

It's pretty popular and can get crowded resulting in a wait (and you can't make reservations) but the bar usually has space. I don't prefer coming here with a group since I usually feel like it's a tight squeeze...like if I turn wrong I might hit someone at another table accidentally. 

Cute area so this is a good place to catch a bite before exploring the area

The waitress was very friendly and helpful. The food was delicious, I had the BBQ Mac n Cheese Burger.  The highlight of the experience was the funnel cake fries!  I've had funnel cake before at the fair but for some reason, this tasted different.  And with the raspberry dipping jelly, it was a hit out the park.  I highly recommend this to top off your Vortex dining experience.

photos.caption: Funnel Cake Fries with raspberry dipping jelly

comment.text: I don't really understand the hype. It's a good burger, edgy atmosphere. I appreciate the cool dive bar atmosphere more than the food, if I'm honest. Don't get me wrong, I'll still go there - but it's not a burger I'd go out of my way for. And parking can be difficult, plus the long waits....meh. I know it's an atlanta institution, and everyone should try it. But I can think of several better burgers. Don't hate.
The pickle rick was amazing!!!! I also got the bartenders choice shot!! I'm one happy camper
Worst service ever. The GM was so ill accommodating!! Don't ever eat here if you need to feed large groups or preorder food ZERO STARS!!

Put fried pickles, bacon, Szechuan sauce, and a funky kind of cheese on an already great tasting, 8oz. Burger and you've got the Pickle Rick at the Vortex.  This delicious burger is one of the best I've ever had, and that includes 60 years of chowing down on burgers.  
The server we had was attentive, smart, and friendly.  Also, you won't see another restaurant with decor that is anything close to their eclectic collection of stuff.  This includes a giant motorcycle hanging from the ceiling and many signed photos from dubious celebrities.
If there is line to get in, wait.  It is worth it.
EMMY ROOOOCCCCKKKKKKSSSSS!!! Great burgers, great service, great atmosphere. If you don't eat here, you're missing out on an Atlanta must-try local eatery. 5 stars every damn visit.

my favorite parts about vortex are that they take no shit   and don't let customers walk all over or abuse employees. every restaurant should be like this. anyways, the vibe and decor here were really fun, and the music is great too. our server was super nice and funny. i wasn't the biggest fan of the mac n cheesy changa but my boyfriend demolished it. the holy guacamole burger was great and cooked perfectly. highly recommend for a night out with friends.
I visited the location in Midtown a few years back and the burgers were great and excellent service! Definitely have to try one of the coronary bypass burgers

photos.caption: Classic Bypass Burger....hamburger topped with a fried egg, 3 slices of American cheese. 4 slices of bacon and LTOP

comment.text: Racist place I would not recommend any of my black and brown people to go here. Me and my friend went at 12am they gave us a hard time because they are suppose to be closed but I had to use the restroom to our surprise we walk in and see nothing but white people seated not a soul in there was about to get up and leave they where very much open. I had words with the manager. And she told me they close at 12 but yet everyone was still seated and online it still saids 3am. It wasn't until I said she was racist that she offered us drinks. We refused. She told us it was a mistake online and it would be changed to the proper time 2 weeks later it still saids 3am lol . My black and brown people do not go here they where better off having white only outside the door.

Since seeing this place featured on "Man vs Food", I couldn't wait to come inside its mouth ... and try the Fat Elvis Burger topped with Cheese, Bacon, Peanut Butter, and Fried Bananas ... Thank you, thank you very much.

photos.caption: It's good to be the King.
Sadly, the Chili taste like converted French Onion Soup.
I'm going to need a bigger Beer.

comment.text:
I have lived in Atlanta for all of of my life (until recently) and I had never visited the Vortex despite hearing raves about it.

I finally had the chance to go since I was in Atlanta for the holidays as well as being 21+. They had such a variety of drinks to choose from but I decided on the Bloosberry cocktail and it was a good choice. I also ordered a veggie cheeseburger with tator tots. The veggie burger was slightly burnt and I have definitely had better veggie burgers elsewhere, however the tator tots were cooked to perfection so I cant complain.

Do not come to the Vortex expecting and exceptional meal, but it will keep you satisfied at a fair price and the vibe and environment is really cool.

Ok I once visited in my early 20 (geesh) and I don't remember all this AMAZINGLY GLORIOUS DELICIOUSNESS .  This location has plenty parking, amazing drinks (duh issa bar), and the staff are a bit rough around the edges just the way I like it. We had a group of 6 and all got different things. There was nothing to complaint about! The food was expertly prepared, we most definitely over indulged. I can honestly say I would make the 2 hour drive just for the Havana en Atlanta aka the Cuban sandwich. This place is full of guilty pleasures, hang over cures, prevention and causes. Do not go with light appetite they plate and pour heavy.

Meh, It's not the best but it's not the worst. Let me explain..

Atmosphere - I will give 5 stars for that. I love all the decorations on the wall, and its very relaxing inside. There's booth and table options as well as a bar. They have all different kinds of beer on top and wines available too. 

Service - We only had what we thought was 45 minutes before my flight and had plenty of time to order several drinks, 2 burgers and appetizers. The server was very nice and friendly, so I will give 5 stars there too. 

Parking- Enough parking in the back when it's not too busy, but I could see it being an issue if it's very very crowded. We went on a Monday afternoon and it was still decently busy just an FYI. 

Food- Now here is where I have the main issue. I got the burger with provolone cheese, mushrooms and steak sauce. To be honest I thought it was huge and awkward to eat. Plus the beef tasted very charred and I did not taste any seasoning in the meat, couldn't taste salt or anything. Yeah the steak sauce made up for that , but not enough to cover the slightly burnt flavor. So meh. I got a side of fried zucchini and my friend got the tator tots. Looking back I should've gotten the tator tots. I like my fried zucchini breaded, not battered. But if you like battered fried zucchini, then that's the choice for you. 

Over all, I'd go back here but honestly just for drinks and appetizers. I've had way better burgers in Texas so maybe I'm spoiled. 

P.S. they do allow smoking. When it wasn't too crowded I couldn't smell it. But I can imagine it could be bad when lots of people are there.
